definitions.definition: Something enclosed, i.e. inserted into a letter or similar package.
definitions.example: There was an enclosure with the letter — a photo.

definitions.definition: The act of enclosing, i.e. the insertion or inclusion of an item in a letter or package.
definitions.example: The enclosure of a photo with your letter is appreciated.

definitions.definition: An area, domain, or amount of something partially or entirely enclosed by barriers.
definitions.example: He faced punishment for creating the fenced enclosure in a public park.

definitions.definition: The act of separating and surrounding an area, domain, or amount of something with a barrier.
definitions.example: At first, untrained horses resist enclosure.

definitions.definition: (British History) The post-feudal process of subdivision of common lands for individual ownership.
The area of a convent, monastery, etc where access is restricted to community members.
